import React, { useState } from "react"; import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom"; import { items } from "./Data"; export default function Navbar({ setData, cart }) { const [searchItem, setSearchItem] = useState(""); const navigate = useNavigate(); const filterCategory = (category) => { if (category === "all") { setData(items); } else { const elements = items.filter((product) => product.category === category); setData(elements); } }; const style = { cursor:"pointer", } const filterPrice = (price) => { const filteredItems = items.filter((product) => Number(product.price) >= price); setData(filteredItems); }; const handleSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); navigate(/search/${searchItem}); setSearchItem(""); }; return ( <> <header className="sticky"> <div className="navbar"> <Link to={"/"} className="heading"> <h1>E-Commerce</h1> </Link> <form className="search-bar" onSubmit={handleSubmit}> <input value={searchItem} onChange={(e) => setSearchItem(e.target.value)} type="text" placeholder="Search Products" /> </form> <Link to={"/cart"} className="icon-section custom-btn"> Cart <span className="custom-badge"> {cart.length} <span className="visually-hidden">unread messages</span> </span> </Link> </div> <div className="nav-bar-wrapper"> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("all")}>No Filter</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("mobiles")}>Mobiles</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("laptops")}>Laptops</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("tablets")}>Tablets</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(29999)}>{">="}29999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(49999)}>{">="}49999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(69999)}>{">="}69999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(89999)}>{">="}99999</div> </div> </header> </> ); } import React, { useState } from "react"; import { createBrowserRouter, RouterProvider } from "react-router-dom"; import Navbar from "./components/Navbar"; import Product from "./components/Product"; import ProductDetail from "./components/ProductDetail"; import SearchItem from "./components/Search"; import Cart from "./components/Cart"; import { items } from "./components/Data"; const App = () => { const [data, setData] = useState([...items]); const [cart, setCart] = useState([]); const router = createBrowserRouter([ { path: "/", element: ( <> <Navbar cart={cart} setData={setData} /> <Product items={data} cart={cart} setCart={setCart} /> </> ), }, { path: "/product/:id", element: ( <> <Navbar /> <ProductDetail /> </> ), }, { path: "/search/:term", element: ( <> <Navbar /> <SearchItem /> </> ), }, { path: "/cart", element: ( <> <Navbar /> <Cart /> </> ), }, ]); return <RouterProvider router={router} />; }; export default App; check erro
ChatGPT said:

Issue Analysis

The provided code appears correct in general structure and logic, but there are a few potential areas where errors might arise:

1. cart.length Error

If cart is not properly passed as a prop to Navbar, or if cart is not initialized correctly, attempting to access cart.length will throw an error.

  • Fix:
    • Ensure cart is initialized as an empty array in App:
      jsx
      const [cart, setCart] = useState([]);
    • Ensure cart is passed correctly to Navbar:
      jsx
      <Navbar cart={cart} setData={setData} />

2. filterCategory and filterPrice Functions

If items is undefined or empty, the filtering logic might fail.

  • Fix: Ensure items is properly imported and passed:
    jsx
    import { items } from "./components/Data";
const [data, setData] = useState([...items]);

3. Search Functionality

The handleSubmit function might not work if searchItem is empty, or if navigate is not set up correctly.

  • Fix: Add a check for empty searchItem:
    jsx
    const handleSubmit = (e) => {
  e.preventDefault();
  if (!searchItem.trim()) return;
  navigate(`/search/${searchItem.trim()}`);
  setSearchItem("");
};

4. custom-badge Class for Cart

If the CSS class for custom-badge is not defined, the badge might not display properly.

  • Fix: Ensure the following CSS is added:
    css
    .custom-btn {
  position: relative;
  background-color: #0d6efd; /* Primary blue */
  color: white;
  padding: 10px 20px;
  font-size: 16px;
  border-radius: 5px;
  border: none;
  cursor: pointer;
  font-weight: bold;
  text-decoration: none;
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
}

.custom-badge {
  position: absolute;
  top: -5px;
  right: -5px;
  background-color: #dc3545; /* Danger red */
  color: white;
  font-size: 12px;
  padding: 5px 10px;
  border-radius: 50%;
  font-weight: bold;
  transform: translate(50%, -50%);
}

.visually-hidden {
  position: absolute;
  width: 1px;
  height: 1px;
  padding: 0;
  margin: -1px;
  overflow: hidden;
  clip: rect(0, 0, 0, 0);
  white-space: nowrap;
  border: 0;
}

5. RouterProvider Errors

If there is an issue with the route paths, or if createBrowserRouter is not correctly set up, navigation might fail.

  • Fix: Ensure all routes are correctly configured and elements are properly structured:
    jsx
    const router = createBrowserRouter([
  {
    path: "/",
    element: (
      <>
        <Navbar cart={cart} setData={setData} />
        <Product items={data} cart={cart} setCart={setCart} />
      </>
    ),
  },
  // Other routes...
]);

Final Updated Code

Navbar Component

jsx
import React, { useState } from "react";
import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import { items } from "./Data";

export default function Navbar({ setData, cart = [] }) {
  const [searchItem, setSearchItem] = useState("");
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const filterCategory = (category) => {
    if (category === "all") {
      setData(items);
    } else {
      const elements = items.filter((product) => product.category === category);
      setData(elements);
    }
  };

  const style = {
    cursor: "pointer",
  };

  const filterPrice = (price) => {
    const filteredItems = items.filter((product) => Number(product.price) >= price);
    setData(filteredItems);
  };

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    if (!searchItem.trim()) return;
    navigate(`/search/${searchItem.trim()}`);
    setSearchItem("");
  };

  return (
    <>
      <header className="sticky">
        <div className="navbar">
          <Link to={"/"} className="heading">
            <h1>E-Commerce</h1>
          </Link>

          <form className="search-bar" onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
            <input
              value={searchItem}
              onChange={(e) => setSearchItem(e.target.value)}
              type="text"
              placeholder="Search Products"
            />
          </form>

          <Link to={"/cart"} className="icon-section custom-btn">
            Cart
            <span className="custom-badge">
              {cart.length}
              <span className="visually-hidden">unread messages</span>
            </span>
          </Link>
        </div>
        <div className="nav-bar-wrapper">
          <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("all")}>No Filter</div>
          <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("mobiles")}>Mobiles</div>
          <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("laptops")}>Laptops</div>
          <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("tablets")}>Tablets</div>
          <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(29999)}>{">="}29999</div>
          <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(49999)}>{">="}49999</div>
          <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(69999)}>{">="}69999</div>
          <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(89999)}>{">="}99999</div>
        </div>
      </header>
    </>
  );
}

Test Scenarios

  1. Ensure the cart badge (cart.length) updates correctly.
  2. Verify that filtering by category and price works as expected.
  3. Confirm that the search functionality navigates correctly.
  4. Test all routes to ensure they render without errors.

Let me know if this resolves your issue! 😊

You said:
value of cart not update, cart.length
ChatGPT said:

The issue with cart.length not updating likely arises because the cart state is not shared properly between the components where it is updated and displayed. Here’s how you can fix it:

Steps to Fix

  1. Ensure cart State is Passed Correctly The cart state and setCart function should be passed from the parent (App component) to both the Navbar and Product components to ensure updates are reflected correctly.

    jsx
    <Navbar cart={cart} setData={setData} />
<Product items={data} cart={cart} setCart={setCart} />

  1. Ensure setCart Updates the State Correctly When updating the cart in Product, ensure you use the previous state for immutability.

    jsx
    const addtoCart = (id, price, title, description, imgSrc) => {
  const obj = { id, price, title, description, imgSrc };
  setCart((prevCart) => [...prevCart, obj]);
};

  1. Check Navbar for Cart Updates The Navbar component receives the cart prop. Ensure it reflects the latest length of the cart.

    jsx
    <span className="custom-badge">{cart.length}</span>
  1. Debugging Steps
    • Add a console.log(cart) in Navbar to confirm the cart updates correctly.
    • Confirm addtoCart in the Product component is called with the correct arguments.

Final Code

App.js

jsx
import React, { useState } from "react";
import { createBrowserRouter, RouterProvider } from "react-router-dom";
import Navbar from "./components/Navbar";
import Product from "./components/Product";
import ProductDetail from "./components/ProductDetail";
import SearchItem from "./components/Search";
import Cart from "./components/Cart";
import { items } from "./components/Data";

const App = () => {
  const [data, setData] = useState([...items]);
  const [cart, setCart] = useState([]); // Cart state

  const router = createBrowserRouter([
    {
      path: "/",
      element: (
        <>
          <Navbar cart={cart} setData={setData} />
          <Product items={data} cart={cart} setCart={setCart} />
        </>
      ),
    },
    {
      path: "/product/:id",
      element: (
        <>
          <Navbar cart={cart} />
          <ProductDetail />
        </>
      ),
    },
    {
      path: "/search/:term",
      element: (
        <>
          <Navbar cart={cart} />
          <SearchItem />
        </>
      ),
    },
    {
      path: "/cart",
      element: (
        <>
          <Navbar cart={cart} />
          <Cart cart={cart} />
        </>
      ),
    },
  ]);

  return <RouterProvider router={router} />;
};

export default App;

Product.js

jsx
import React from "react";
import { Link } from "react-router-dom";
import { ToastContainer, toast, Bounce } from "react-toastify";
import "react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css";

export default function Product({ items = [], cart, setCart }) {
  if (!Array.isArray(items) || items.length === 0) {
    return <p>No products available.</p>;
  }

  const addtoCart = (id, price, title, description, imgSrc) => {
    const obj = { id, price, title, description, imgSrc };
    setCart((prevCart) => [...prevCart, obj]);

    toast.success("Item added to Cart", {
      position: "top-right",
      autoClose: 1500,
      hideProgressBar: false,
      closeOnClick: true,
      pauseOnHover: true,
      draggable: true,
      progress: undefined,
      theme: "dark",
      transition: Bounce,
    });
  };

  return (
    <>
      <ToastContainer />
      <div className="product-main">
        {items.map((curData) => (
          <div className="products-card" key={curData.id}>
            <Link to={`product/${curData.id}`}>
              <div className="product-img">
                <img src={curData.imgSrc} alt="Image is Loading" />
              </div>
            </Link>
            <div className="product-header">{curData.title}</div>
            <div className="product-des">{curData.description}</div>
            <div className="product-btn">
              <button className="pro-price">{curData.price} Pkr</button>
              <button
                className="pro-cart"
                onClick={() =>
                  addtoCart(
                    curData.id,
                    curData.price,
                    curData.title,
                    curData.description,
                    curData.imgSrc
                  )
                }
              >
                Add to Cart
              </button>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </div>
    </>
  );
}

Navbar.js

jsx
import React, { useState } from "react";
import { Link, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom";
import { items } from "./Data";

export default function Navbar({ setData, cart = [] }) {
  const [searchItem, setSearchItem] = useState("");
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const handleSubmit = (e) => {
    e.preventDefault();
    if (!searchItem.trim()) return;
    navigate(`/search/${searchItem.trim()}`);
    setSearchItem("");
  };

  return (
    <>
      <header className="sticky">
        <div className="navbar">
          <Link to={"/"} className="heading">
            <h1>E-Commerce</h1>
          </Link>

          <form className="search-bar" onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
            <input
              value={searchItem}
              onChange={(e) => setSearchItem(e.target.value)}
              type="text"
              placeholder="Search Products"
            />
          </form>

          <Link to={"/cart"} className="icon-section custom-btn">
            Cart
            <span className="custom-badge">{cart.length}</span>
            <span className="visually-hidden">unread messages</span>
          </Link>
        </div>
      </header>
    </>
  );
}

What Was Fixed

  1. Passed cart and setCart correctly to both Navbar and Product components.
  2. Used setCart immutably to update the state in Product.
  3. Added default value for cart in Navbar to avoid undefined errors.
  4. Added a debug log in addtoCart to confirm the cart updates properly.
You said:
<div class="card mb-3" style="max-width: 540px;"> <div class="row g-0"> <div class="col-md-4"> <img src="..." class="img-fluid rounded-start" alt="..."> </div> <div class="col-md-8"> <div class="card-body"> <h5 class="card-title">Card title</h5> <p class="card-text">This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.</p> <p class="card-text"><small class="text-body-secondary">Last updated 3 mins ago</small></p> </div> </div> </div> </div> convert into html css file without comments
ChatGPT said:

HTML

html
<div class="card-container">
  <div class="card-row">
    <div class="card-img-container">
      <img src="..." class="card-img" alt="...">
    </div>
    <div class="card-content-container">
      <div class="card-body">
        <h5 class="card-title">Card title</h5>
        <p class="card-text">This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.</p>
        <p class="card-text"><small class="card-small-text">Last updated 3 mins ago</small></p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

CSS

css
.card-container {
  max-width: 540px;
  margin-bottom: 16px;
  border: 1px solid #ccc;
  border-radius: 8px;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.card-row {
  display: flex;
  gap: 0;
}

.card-img-container {
  flex: 1;
}

.card-img {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  object-fit: cover;
  border-radius: 8px 0 0 8px;
}

.card-content-container {
  flex: 2;
  padding: 16px;
}

.card-body {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
}

.card-title {
  font-size: 1.25rem;
  margin-bottom: 8px;
}

.card-text {
  font-size: 1rem;
  margin-bottom: 8px;
  color: #333;
}

.card-small-text {
  font-size: 0.875rem;
  color: #6c757d;
}
You said:
add filter section as well
2/2
ChatGPT said:

HTML with Filter Section

html
<div class="filter-section">
  <button class="filter-btn" onclick="filterCards('all')">All</button>
  <button class="filter-btn" onclick="filterCards('recent')">Recent</button>
  <button class="filter-btn" onclick="filterCards('popular')">Popular</button>
</div>

<div class="card-container">
  <div class="card-row" data-category="recent">
    <div class="card-img-container">
      <img src="..." class="card-img" alt="...">
    </div>
    <div class="card-content-container">
      <div class="card-body">
        <h5 class="card-title">Card title</h5>
        <p class="card-text">This is a wider card with supporting text below as a natural lead-in to additional content. This content is a little bit longer.</p>
        <p class="card-text"><small class="card-small-text">Last updated 3 mins ago</small></p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="card-container">
  <div class="card-row" data-category="popular">
    <div class="card-img-container">
      <img src="..." class="card-img" alt="...">
    </div>
    <div class="card-content-container">
      <div class="card-body">
        <h5 class="card-title">Another Card</h5>
        <p class="card-text">This card contains different content for demonstration purposes.</p>
        <p class="card-text"><small class="card-small-text">Last updated 5 mins ago</small></p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

CSS for Filter Section

css
.filter-section {
  margin-bottom: 16px;
  display: flex;
  gap: 10px;
  justify-content: center;
}

.filter-btn {
  background-color: #007bff;
  color: white;
  border: none;
  padding: 10px 20px;
  border-radius: 5px;
  cursor: pointer;
  font-size: 1rem;
}

.filter-btn:hover {
  background-color: #0056b3;
}

.filter-btn.active {
  background-color: #0056b3;
}

.card-container {
  max-width: 540px;
  margin-bottom: 16px;
  border: 1px solid #ccc;
  border-radius: 8px;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.card-row {
  display: flex;
  gap: 0;
}

.card-img-container {
  flex: 1;
}

.card-img {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  object-fit: cover;
  border-radius: 8px 0 0 8px;
}

.card-content-container {
  flex: 2;
  padding: 16px;
}

.card-body {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
}

.card-title {
  font-size: 1.25rem;
  margin-bottom: 8px;
}

.card-text {
  font-size: 1rem;
  margin-bottom: 8px;
  color: #333;
}

.card-small-text {
  font-size: 0.875rem;
  color: #6c757d;
}

JavaScript for Filtering

javascript
function filterCards(category) {
  const cards = document.querySelectorAll('.card-container');
  cards.forEach((card) => {
    if (category === 'all' || card.querySelector('.card-row').dataset.category === category) {
      card.style.display = 'block';
    } else {
      card.style.display = 'none';
    }
  });

  const buttons = document.querySelectorAll('.filter-btn');
  buttons.forEach((btn) => btn.classList.remove('active'));
  document.querySelector(`.filter-btn[onclick="filterCards('${category}')"]`).classList.add('active');
}

This setup adds a filter section above the cards. When you click on a filter button, it shows the relevant cards based on their category (recent, popular, etc.). All cards are shown when "All" is clicked.

2/2

Here is the updated project structure with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files. These files integrate a filter section with the card layout and functionality.

HTML (index.html)

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
  <title>Filterable Cards</title>
</head>
<body>
  <header class="header">
    <h1>Filterable Cards</h1>
  </header>

  <section class="filter-section">
    <button class="filter-btn" onclick="filterCards('all')">All</button>
    <button class="filter-btn" onclick="filterCards('recent')">Recent</button>
    <button class="filter-btn" onclick="filterCards('popular')">Popular</button>
  </section>

  <main class="cards-container">
    <div class="card-container">
      <div class="card-row" data-category="recent">
        <div class="card-img-container">
          <img src="https://via.placeholder.com/150" class="card-img" alt="Card Image">
        </div>
        <div class="card-content-container">
          <div class="card-body">
            <h5 class="card-title">Recent Card</h5>
            <p class="card-text">This is a recent card with some additional information.</p>
            <p class="card-text"><small class="card-small-text">Last updated 1 min ago</small></p>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="card-container">
      <div class="card-row" data-category="popular">
        <div class="card-img-container">
          <img src="https://via.placeholder.com/150" class="card-img" alt="Card Image">
        </div>
        <div class="card-content-container">
          <div class="card-body">
            <h5 class="card-title">Popular Card</h5>
            <p class="card-text">This is a popular card with some additional information.</p>
            <p class="card-text"><small class="card-small-text">Last updated 5 mins ago</small></p>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="card-container">
      <div class="card-row" data-category="recent">
        <div class="card-img-container">
          <img src="https://via.placeholder.com/150" class="card-img" alt="Card Image">
        </div>
        <div class="card-content-container">
          <div class="card-body">
            <h5 class="card-title">Another Recent Card</h5>
            <p class="card-text">This is another recent card with some additional information.</p>
            <p class="card-text"><small class="card-small-text">Last updated 10 mins ago</small></p>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </main>

  <script src="script.js"></script>

</html>

CSS (style.css)

css
body {
  font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  background-color: #f8f9fa;
}

.header {
  text-align: center;
  padding: 20px;
  background-color: #007bff;
  color: white;
}

.filter-section {
  margin: 20px;
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  gap: 10px;
}

.filter-btn {
  background-color: #007bff;
  color: white;
  border: none;
  padding: 10px 20px;
  border-radius: 5px;
  cursor: pointer;
  font-size: 1rem;
}

.filter-btn:hover {
  background-color: #0056b3;
}

.filter-btn.active {
  background-color: #0056b3;
}

.cards-container {
  display: flex;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  gap: 20px;
  justify-content: center;
  margin: 20px;
}

.card-container {
  max-width: 540px;
  width: 100%;
  border: 1px solid #ccc;
  border-radius: 8px;
  overflow: hidden;
  background-color: white;
}

.card-row {
  display: flex;
}

.card-img-container {
  flex: 1;
}

.card-img {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  object-fit: cover;
}

.card-content-container {
  flex: 2;
  padding: 16px;
}

.card-body {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
}

.card-title {
  font-size: 1.25rem;
  margin-bottom: 8px;
}

.card-text {
  font-size: 1rem;
  margin-bottom: 8px;
  color: #333;
}

.card-small-text {
  font-size: 0.875rem;
  color: #6c757d;
}

JavaScript (script.js)

javascript
function filterCards(category) {
  const cards = document.querySelectorAll('.card-container');
  cards.forEach((card) => {
    if (category === 'all' || card.querySelector('.card-row').dataset.category === category) {
      card.style.display = 'block';
    } else {
      card.style.display = 'none';
    }
  });

  const buttons = document.querySelectorAll('.filter-btn');
  buttons.forEach((btn) => btn.classList.remove('active'));
  document.querySelector(`.filter-btn[onclick="filterCards('${category}')"]`).classList.add('active');
}

How It Works

  1. HTML: Defines a layout with a filter section and multiple cards. Each card is assigned a data-category attribute to determine its filter group.
  2. CSS: Provides styles for the filter buttons, cards, and general layout.
  3. JavaScript: Handles the filtering logic. When a filter button is clicked, it hides or shows cards based on their data-category attribute.

This project is now a fully functional filterable card layout.

You said:
{ location.pathname("/") && ( <div className="nav-bar-wrapper"> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("all")}>No Filter</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("mobiles")}>Mobiles</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("laptops")}>Laptops</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("tablets")}>Tablets</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(29999)}>{">="}29999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(49999)}>{">="}49999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(69999)}>{">="}69999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(89999)}>{">="}99999</div> </div> ) } tell me in simple and easy words
ChatGPT said:

This code snippet dynamically renders a navigation bar with filtering options based on the current page's URL path. Here's how it works in simple terms:

  1. location.pathname("/"): This checks if the current URL path is / (the homepage).

    • If this condition is true, the code inside the parentheses is executed, which means the filter options will be displayed.

  2. Filter Section (div.nav-bar-wrapper):

    • It contains several items, each acting as a filter button (like "No Filter", "Mobiles", "Laptops", etc.).
    • These buttons trigger specific functions (filterCategory or filterPrice) when clicked:
      • filterCategory("all"): Displays all items.
      • filterCategory("mobiles"): Displays only items in the "mobiles" category.
      • filterPrice(29999): Displays items with a price greater than or equal to 29999.

  3. style: This applies inline CSS to each item, making the cursor look like a pointer when hovering over these buttons.

Summary:

  • The navigation bar (nav-bar-wrapper) is only shown if the user is on the homepage (/).
  • The buttons in this navigation bar allow users to filter products based on categories or price ranges.

import React from 'react' import { Link } from 'react-router-dom' export default function Cart({ cart, setCart }) { const style = { cursor: "pointer", }; return ( <> <div className="containers"> { cart.length == 0 ? ( <> <h1>Your Cart is Empty</h1> <Link to={"/"} className='carts'>Continue Shopping...</Link> </> ) : cart.map((product) => { return ( <> <div className="card-container" style={{ width: '700px' }}> <div className="card-row"> <div className="card-img-container"> <img src={product.imgSrc} className="card-img" alt="..." /> </div> <div className="card-content-container"> <div className="card-body"> <h5 className="card-title">{product.title}</h5> <p className="card-text">{product.description}</p> <div className="btns-cart"> <button style={style} className="pro-price">{product.price} Pkr</button> <button style={style} className="pro-cart">Buy Now</button> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </> ) }) } </div> { cart.length!=0 &&( <div className="container"> <button style={style} className='pro-cart'>CheckOut</button> <button style={{backgroundColor:"red"}} onClick={()=>setCart("")} className='pro-price'>Clear Cart</button> </div> ) } </> ) } import React, { useState } from "react"; import { Link, useLocation, useNavigate } from "react-router-dom"; import { items } from "./Data"; import { FaCartArrowDown } from 'react-icons/fa6'; export default function Navbar({ setData, cart = [] }) { const location = useLocation(); const [searchItem, setSearchItem] = useState(""); const navigate = useNavigate(); const filterCategory = (category) => { if (category === "all") { setData(items); } else { const elements = items.filter((product) => product.category === category); setData(elements); } }; const style = { cursor: "pointer", }; const filterPrice = (price) => { const filteredItems = items.filter((product) => Number(product.price) >= price); setData(filteredItems); }; const handleSubmit = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); if (!searchItem.trim()) return; navigate(/search/${searchItem.trim()}); setSearchItem(""); }; return ( <> <header className="sticky"> <div className="navbar"> <Link to={"/"} className="heading"> <h1>E-Commerce</h1> </Link> <form className="search-bar" onSubmit={handleSubmit}> <input value={searchItem} onChange={(e) => setSearchItem(e.target.value)} type="text" placeholder="Search Products" /> </form> <Link to={"/cart"} className="icon-section custom-btn"> <FaCartArrowDown style={{fontSize:"1.5rem"}} /> <span className="custom-badge">{cart.length}</span> <span className="visually-hidden">unread messages</span> </Link> </div> { location.pathname == "/" && ( <div className="nav-bar-wrapper"> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("all")}>No Filter</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("mobiles")}>Mobiles</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("laptops")}>Laptops</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterCategory("tablets")}>Tablets</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(29999)}>{">="}29999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(49999)}>{">="}49999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(69999)}>{">="}69999</div> <div className="item" style={style} onClick={() => filterPrice(89999)}>{">="}99999</div> </div> ) } </header> </> ); } import React from "react"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; import { ToastContainer, toast, Bounce } from "react-toastify"; import "react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css"; export default function Product({ items = [], cart, setCart }) { if (!Array.isArray(items) || items.length === 0) { return <p>No products available.</p>; } const addtoCart = (id, price, title, description, imgSrc) => { const obj = { id, price, title, description, imgSrc }; setCart((prevCart) => [...prevCart, obj]); toast.success("Item added to Cart", { position: "top-right", autoClose: 1500, hideProgressBar: false, closeOnClick: true, pauseOnHover: true, draggable: true, progress: undefined, theme: "dark", transition: Bounce, }); }; return ( <> <ToastContainer /> <div className="product-main"> {items.map((curData) => ( <div className="products-card" key={curData.id}> <Link to={product/${curData.id}}> <div className="product-img"> <img src={curData.imgSrc} alt="Image is Loading" /> </div> </Link> <div className="product-header">{curData.title}</div> <div className="product-des">{curData.description}</div> <div className="product-btn"> <button className="pro-price">{curData.price} Pkr</button> <button className="pro-cart" onClick={() => addtoCart( curData.id, curData.price, curData.title, curData.description, curData.imgSrc ) } > Add to Cart </button> </div> </div> ))} </div> </> ); } import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react"; import { useParams } from "react-router-dom"; import { items } from "./Data"; import Product from "./Product"; import { ToastContainer, toast, Bounce } from "react-toastify"; import "react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css"; export default function ProductDetail({ cart, setCart}) { const style = { cursor: "pointer", }; const addtoCart = (id, price, title, description, imgSrc) => { const obj = { id, price, title, description, imgSrc }; setCart((prevCart) => [...prevCart, obj]); toast.success("Item added to Cart", { position: "top-right", autoClose: 1500, hideProgressBar: false, closeOnClick: true, pauseOnHover: true, draggable: true, progress: undefined, theme: "dark", transition: Bounce, }); }; const { id } = useParams(); const [product, setProduct] = useState(null); const [relatedProducts, setRelatedProducts] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { const currentProduct = items.find((item) => item.id === Number(id)); setProduct(currentProduct); if (currentProduct) { const related = items.filter( (item) => item.category === currentProduct.category && item.id !== currentProduct.id ); setRelatedProducts(related); } }, [id]); if (!product) { return <p>Loading product details...</p>; } return ( <> <ToastContainer /> <div className="detail-container"> <div className="img"> <img src={product.imgSrc} alt={product.title} /> </div> <div className="detail-des"> <div className="detail-title"> <h3>{product.title}</h3> </div> <div className="detail-para"> <p>{product.description}</p> </div> <div className="product-btn"> <button className="pro-price">{product.price} Pkr</button> <button className="pro-cart" style={style} onClick={() => addtoCart( product.id, product.price, product.title, product.description, product.imgSrc ) } > Add to Cart </button> </div> </div> </div> <h3 style={{ textAlign: "center", fontSize: "42px" }}>Related Products</h3> <div style={{ marginLeft: "100px" }}> <Product cart={cart} setCart={setCart} items={relatedProducts} /> </div> </> ); } import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react' import { useParams } from 'react-router-dom' import { items } from './Data'; import Product from './Product'; export default function Search({cart,setCart}) { const {term} = useParams(); const [filterdata, setFilterdata] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { const filterData = () => { const data = items.filter((e) => e.title.toLowerCase().includes(term.toLowerCase()) ); setFilterdata(data); }; filterData(); }, [term]); return ( <> <Product cart={cart} setCart={setCart} items={filterdata}/> </> ) } import React, { useState } from "react"; import { createBrowserRouter, RouterProvider } from "react-router-dom"; import Navbar from "./components/Navbar"; import Product from "./components/Product"; import ProductDetail from "./components/ProductDetail"; import SearchItem from "./components/Search"; import Cart from "./components/Cart"; import { items } from "./components/Data"; const App = () => { const [data, setData] = useState([...items]); const [cart, setCart] = useState([]); const router = createBrowserRouter([ { path: "/", element: ( <> <Navbar cart={cart} setData={setData} /> <Product items={data} cart={cart} setCart={setCart} /> </> ), }, { path: "/product/:id", element: ( <> <Navbar cart={cart} /> <ProductDetail cart={cart} setCart={setCart} /> </> ), }, { path: "/search/:term", element: ( <> <Navbar cart={cart} /> <SearchItem cart={cart} setCart={setCart} /> </> ), }, { path: "/cart", element: ( <> <Navbar cart={cart} /> <Cart cart={cart} setCart={setCart} /> </> ), }, ]); return <RouterProvider router={router} />; }; export default App; this is my code, when we click on add to cart this error occur "Unexpected Application Error!
